title: Lizard Identification
description: Scale up your knowledge with this quiz about the incredible diversity of lizards

questions.question: Which lizard is the largest in the world, growing up to 10 feet long and found on Indonesian islands?
Which lizard is famous for its ability to change color based on mood, temperature, and communication?
Which small lizard can walk on walls and ceilings using millions of tiny hair-like structures on its feet?
Which venomous lizard from the American Southwest has a brightly banded pattern of orange/pink and black?
Which Australian lizard has a large frill around its neck that it extends when threatened?
Which popular pet lizard from Australia puffs out its spiny throat (beard) and bobs its head as a display?
Which lizard can run across the surface of water on its hind legs, earning it the nickname 'Jesus Christ Lizard'?
Which slow-moving, legless lizard is often mistaken for a snake but can be identified by its eyelids and ear openings?
Which large lizard from the Galapagos Islands is the only sea-going lizard and dives to feed on algae?
Which Australian lizard is covered in thorny spines and has the remarkable ability to channel water across its skin to its mouth?
Which lizard from the American Southwest and Mexico can squirt blood from its eyes as a defense mechanism?
Which Australian skink has a bright blue tongue that it uses to startle predators?
What special ability do many lizard species, such as geckos and anoles, have regarding their tails?
options: They can wrap them around branches
They can use them as weapons
They can detach and regrow them

questions.question: Which large monitor lizard from Southeast Asia is one of the longest lizards in the world, reaching up to 8 feet?
Which chameleon species holds the record for the longest tongue relative to body size, able to extend its tongue over twice its body length?
